results.adx_keywords: World Cup (Soccer);World Cup 2022 (Soccer);Flags, Emblems and Insignia;United States Soccer Federation;Iran;United States
results.title: Iran Calls for U.S. to Be Expelled From World Cup
results.abstract: U.S. Soccer angered Iran by posting a doctored Iran flag on social media. The Americans said the decision was intentional but later deleted the posts.

results.adx_keywords: Surrogate Motherhood;Parenting;Law and Legislation;Politics and Government;Regulation and Deregulation of Industry;Cambodia
results.byline: By Hannah Beech and Nadia Shira Cohen
results.title: They Were Surrogates. Now They Must Raise the Children.
results.abstract: In Cambodia’s weak legal system, surrogacy exists in a gray market, endangering all involved when political conditions suddenly shift and criminal charges follow.

media.caption: Hun Daneth chose to be a surrogate for a Chinese businessman. After Cambodia banned the practice, she was forced by the courts to raise the child or risk going to jail.
media.copyright: Nadia Shira Cohen for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Demonstrations, Protests and Riots;Politics and Government;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Xi Jinping;Communist Party of China;China;Shanghai (China);Urumqi (China)
results.byline: By Chris Buckley and Muyi Xiao
results.title: Protests Erupt in Shanghai and Other Chinese Cities Over Covid Controls
results.abstract: A chanting crowd called for China’s leader, Xi Jinping, to step down, a rare act of defiance reflecting growing anger after nearly three years of lockdowns.

media.caption: Protesters shouting slogans as police officers looked on in Shanghai on Saturday.
media.copyright: via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Elk;Hunting and Trapping;Maps;Mobile Applications;Land Use Policies;Trespassing;onXmaps Inc;Western States (US);Wyoming
results.title: It’s Public Land. But the Public Can’t Reach It.
results.abstract: A navigation app that illuminates public land within privately held property has supercharged the question of who gets to go where.

media.caption: Elk Mountain in Wyoming is at the center of a legal dispute over access to public land that’s surrounded by a private ranch.
media.copyright: James Stukenberg for The New York Times

results.byline: By Alex Traub and Amanda Holpuch
results.title: Irene Cara, ‘Fame’ and ‘Flashdance’ Singer, Dies at 63
results.abstract: Ms. Cara was a child star from the Bronx who gained fame in the 1980s as a singer of pop anthems and as the star of the movie “Fame.”

media.caption: Irene Cara as Coco Hernandez performing in a scene from the 1980 movie “Fame.” A former child actor, dancer and singer, she was the voice behind two of the biggest movie theme songs of the 1980s.

results.title: In Ukraine, Bakhmut Becomes a Bloody Vortex for 2 Militaries

results.title: Meet the Voters Who Fueled New York’s Seismic Tilt Toward the G.O.P.
results.abstract: Republicans used doomsday-style ads to capitalize on suburban voters’ fear of crime in New York, helping to flip enough seats to capture the House.

results.title: Meet the Man on a Mission to Expose Sneaky Price Increases
results.abstract: Edgar Dworsky has become the go-to expert on “shrinkflation,” when products or packaging are manipulated so people get less for their money.

media.caption: Mr. Dworsky said he looks out for clues like “new and improved” on packaging.
